X. Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Chemical safety is an important part of Carl Buddig and Company operations. Carl Buddig recently conducted an audit of their Process Safety Management Program and will be dutifully implementing the recommendations from that audit. Continuous improvement in safety is an important goal for Carl Buddig and Company. 



XI. Management Program

Carl Buddig and Company has updated a management system to oversee the implementation of the risk management program elements. This system has assigned qualified person(s) (or position) to assist in the development, implementation, and integration of the risk management program elements. If

Incident Investigation - Carl Buddig and Company has updated a site-specific incident investigation procedure that ensures each incident that either results in a release or could have resulted in a release of anhydrous ammonia is investigated, within 48 hours, by a team of at least one person knowledgeable in the process. This procedure will also make provisions to ensure a report is prepared at the conclusion of the investigation and findings are promptly addressed. 

Compliance Audit - Carl Buddig and Company has updated a site-specific compliance audit program that ensures compliance audits are conducted at a minimum of every three years to verify that Carl Buddig and Company PSM/RMP practices and procedures are adequate and are being followed. 

Hot Work Permits - Carl Buddig and Company has updated a best management practice for hot work. 





VII. Five-Year Accident History

The Carl Buddig and Company facility has not had an accidental anhydrous ammonia release, which resulted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage onsite, or known offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage in the last five years. However, small nuisance releases have been investigated in order to prevent repeat occurrences.



VIII. Emergency Response Program

Carl Buddig and Company has developed an emergency action plan to ensure that in the event of an emergency the facility personnel are aware of the appropriate actions to take and authorities to contact in order to mitigate the effects of a release. 



Carl Buddig and Company has communicated and trained facility employees on proper evacuation procedures and has had interaction (i.e. onsite inspections) with the South Holland Fire Department.

Process Safety Information - Carl Buddig and Company maintains a site-specific PSI program that ensures information pertaining to the hazards, technology, and equipment of the process are properly developed and maintained. 

Process Hazard Analysis - Carl Buddig and Company has updated a site-specific PHA program that ensures a PHA is conducted initially, at a minimum of every five (5) years, and whenever a change is significant enough to require a change in PSI. III. Facility Identification

The Carl Buddig and Company facility is located at 2125 Rochester Dr. in Montgomery, Illinois. The facility is a producer of custom and specialty meat products. 



The NAICS code for the facility is 311612. Many areas of the plant are refrigerated to preserve meat and meat products. 



The facility uses ammonia for refrigeration, and is regulated under 40 CFR Part 68, the EPA RMP Rule. There are two (2) refrigeration systems onsite that are used for refrigerating meat and meat products. 



 The South refrigeration system is used to cool production rooms, holding freezers, and the office area. This system is a single stage system with five high stage compressors. Evaporators in the production areas are fed with high pressure liquid from the receiver, through the accumulator.



 The North refrigeration system is used to cool production rooms and holding coolers. It is a single stage system with three high stage compressors. Evaporators in the production areas are fed with high pressure liquid from the receiver, through the accumulator. 



The total amount of ammonia onsite is above the minimum threshold quantity of 10,000 pounds.
